info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 03 at 1:16PM PST until January 04 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow ongoing above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches between 3000 and 4000 foot elevations and 10 to 25 inches above 4000 foot elevations. Winds gusting 50 to 70 mph at higher elevations exposed to south and southwest flow. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County including portions of Sawyers Bar Road and Highway 3 south of Callahan. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
